synthesis_conditions.temperature: Room temperature for synthesis, heated up to 300°C for stability testing
synthesis_conditions.drying_method: Evacuated from the pores within 3 h at room temperature and 5 x 10^-5 torr
synthesis_conditions.additional_information: The synthesis involves the diffusion of triethylamine into a solution of zinc (II) nitrate and H2BDC in DMF/chlorobenzene with a small amount of hydrogen peroxide added. The resulting material, MOF-5, remains crystalline and stable when fully desolvated and when heated up to 300°C.
